metadata.description:
This dataset includes data recorded by the Hydrometeorological observation network obtained from the automatic weather station (AWS) at the observation system of Meteorological elements gradient of Huangzangsi station between 10 June, 2013, and 31 December, 2013. The site (100.192° E, 38.225° N) was located on a cropland (wheat) surface in the Huangzangsi village, Babao town, Qilian County, Qinghai Province. The elevation is 2612 m. The installation heights and orientations of different sensors and measured quantities were as follows: air temperature and humidity profile (HMP45AD; 5 m, north), wind speed and direction profile (03001; 10 m, north), air pressure (278; in the tamper box on the ground), rain gauge (TE525M; 10 m), four-component radiometer (CNR4; 6 m, south), two infrared temperature sensors (IRTC3; 6 m, south, vertically downward), soil heat flux (HFT3; 3 duplicates with G1 below the vegetation; G2 and G3 between plants, -0.06 m), soil temperature profile (AV-10T; 0, -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, and -1.6 m), and soil moisture profile (CS616; -0.04, -0.1, -0.2, -0.4, -0.8, -1.2, and -1.6 m).
The observations included the following: air temperature and humidity (Ta_5 m; RH_5 m) (℃ and %, respectively), wind speed (Ws_10 m) (m/s), wind direction (WD_10 m) (°), air pressure (press) (hpa), precipitation (rain) (mm), four-component radiation (DR, incoming shortwave radiation; UR, outgoing shortwave radiation; DLR_Cor, incoming longwave radiation; ULR_Cor, outgoing longwave radiation; Rn, net radiation) (W/m2), infrared temperature (IRT_1 and IRT_2) (℃), soil heat flux (Gs_1, Gs_2 and Gs_3) (W/m2), soil temperature (Ts_0 cm, Ts_4 cm, Ts_10 cm, Ts_20 cm, Ts_40 cm, Ts_80 cm, Ts_120 cm, and Ts_160 cm) (℃), and soil moisture (Ms_4 cm, Ms_10 cm, Ms_20 cm, Ms_40 cm, Ms_80 cm, Ms_120 cm, and Ms_160 cm) (%, volumetric water content).
The data processing and quality control steps were as follows: (1) The AWS data were averaged over intervals of 10 min for a total of 144 records per day. The missing data were denoted by -6999. (2) Data in duplicate records were rejected. (3) Unphysical data were rejected. (4) The data marked in red are problematic data. (5) The format of the date and time was unified, and the date and time were collected in the same column, for example, date and time: 2013-9-10 10:30. (6) Finally, the naming convention was AWS+ site no. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), Liu et al. (2011) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2013年6月10日至2013年12月31日黑河水文气象观测网上游黄藏寺站气象要素观测数据。站点位于青海省祁连县八宝镇黄藏寺村，下垫面是农田（小麦）。观测点的经纬度是100.1918E, 38.2254N，海拔2612m。空气温度、相对湿度传感器架设在5m处，朝向正北；气压计安装在地面上的防撬箱内；翻斗式雨量计安装在10m处；风速与风向传感器架设在10m，朝向正北；四分量辐射仪安装在6m处，朝向正南；两个红外温度计安装在6m处，朝向正南，探头朝向是垂直向下；土壤温度探头埋设在地表0cm和地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤水分探头埋设在地下4cm、10cm、20cm、40cm、80cm、120cm、160cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方；土壤热流板（3块）依次埋设在地下6cm处，在距离气象塔2m的正南方，其中G1埋设在植被下方，G2和G3埋在棵间。
观测项目有：空气温湿度（Ta_5m、RH_5m）(单位：摄氏度、百分比)、气压（Press）(单位：百帕)、降水量（Rain）(单位：毫米)、风速（WS_10m）(单位：米/秒)、风向（WD_10m）(单位：度)、四分量辐射（DR、UR、DLR_Cor、ULR_Cor、Rn）(单位：瓦/平方米)、地表辐射温度（IRT_1、IRT_2）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤热通量（Gs_1、Gs_2、Gs_3）(单位：瓦/平方米)、土壤温度（Ts_0cm、Ts_4cm、Ts_10cm、Ts_20cm、Ts_40cm、Ts_80cm、Ts_120cm、Ts_160cm）(单位：摄氏度)、土壤水分（Ms_4cm、Ms_10cm、Ms_20cm、Ms_40cm、Ms_80cm、Ms_120cm、Ms_160cm）(单位：体积含水量，百分比)。
观测数据的处理与质量控制：（1）确保每天144个数据（每10min），若出现数据的缺失，则由-6999标示；（2）剔除有重复记录的时刻；（3）删除了明显超出物理意义或超出仪器量程的数据；（4）数据中以红字标示的部分为有疑问的数据；（5）日期和时间的格式统一，并且日期、时间在同一列。如，时间为：2013-9-10 10:30；（6）命名规则为：AWS+站点名称。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散发估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散发，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下，涡度协方差（EC）测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而变得主导。本文显示，与观测的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括离地5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用EC系统在离地4.5米处以10 Hz采样频率测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获取的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估算的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估算也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: The alpine region is important in riverine and watershed ecosystems as a contributor of freshwater, providing and stimulating specific habitats for biodiversity. In parallel, recent climate change, human activities, and other perturbations may disturb hydrological processes and eco-functions, creating the need for next-generation observational and modeling approaches to advance a predictive understanding of such processes in the alpine region. Water resources in the alpine region are headwaters that need to be regulated to sustain downstream ecosystems. However, perturbations induced by nature/climate change and human activities in recent years have significantly reformed hydrological processes and eco-functions. Accurate estimation and prediction of hydrological processes and their key impact factors has since become crucial.

Unfortunately, the scarcity of observation data in the alpine region, due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers, has hindered alpine hydrological modeling and associated research yet motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments. In comparison with the observations, using remote sensing data combined with data assimilation could improve the prediction of hydrological processes. However, due to the complexities of the earth system, there exist various sources of uncertainties in remote sensing data (especially in the alpine region), which have to be validated and calibrated. In summary, to fill the knowledge gap and promote alpine region hydrology research, an integrated, distributed and multiscale observation dataset is essential and expected to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. In alpine hydrology, in addition to consistent hydrometeorological data obtained from distributed meteorological stations, snow cover and frozen ground are two important indexes and driving forces that manipulate hydrological processes. The maximum snow water equivalent (SWE) before ablation determines the storage of snowmelt – a major source of freshwater in the alpine region, while freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs) and soil moisture within the active layer alter water infiltration and, consequently, surface runoff and groundwater. To promote alpine hydrology research, the International Network for Alpine Research Catchment Hydrology (INARCH) was launched in 2015 by the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) project of the World Climate Research Programme (WCRP), involving 18 catchments around the world. The INARCH has since connected individual observatories into an international network and data-share platform to lead frontier research on alpine region hydrometeorology and snow observation. Another community-based observation network, the Circumpolar Active Layer Monitoring (CALM) network, was initiated in the early 1990s to observe the response of the active layer and near-surface permafrost to climate change. The Heihe River Basin (HRB) is the second largest inland river basin in China and is known for its heterogeneous landscapes, diverse ecosystems, unique geographical characteristics and climate change over recent decades. As a major component of the ecohydrological processes in the arid/semi-arid HRB, the alpine hydrological processes, especially those related to snow cover and frozen ground in the upper reaches, have great impacts on runoff in the mountainous region, which then regulate agricultural development in the middle reaches and the ecosystems of the lower reaches.

In recent years, with climate warming, permafrost degradation has significantly affected runoff and the carbon cycle (Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018). Snow cover is widely distributed with unique characteristics in the study area. In the high-altitude mountainous region (elevation > 3800 m), influenced by the local microclimate and low temperature, snowfall could occur in any season. Temporary snow is the major snow cover type in the region at middle and low elevations because strong solar radiation and high air temperature lead to fast melting and sublimation of the snow. Drifting snow is also commonly observed in the region, which may lead to the redistribution of snowpack in high elevation regions (Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014).

Blowing (drifting) snow is commonly observed in the Qilian mountain due to its high altitude and complex terrain. It is important to estimate the occurrence of blowing snow because it may cause redistributions of the snow cover and influence the sublimation of snow.

Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. Therefore, site observations can be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.

The associated open-access datasets include high-quality hydrometeorological data with specific respect to snow and frozen ground observations at the sub-basin and basin scales, which aims to address a variety of scientific questions including but not limited to: (1) how to provide accurate and effective forcing data for alpine hydrological models, (2) how to integrate observation, simulation and the acquired datasets for informative understanding, and (3) how perturbations (climate change and human activities) alter fundamental processes.

Considering the characteristics of the study site, an integrated, distributed and multiscale hydrometeorological – snow – frozen ground observation network has been established with seven automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) and two superstations. At the basin scale, the observation aims to collect data for investigating the meteorological driving forces and for validation of the alpine hydrological models. At the sub-basin scale, small-scale observations and measurements focus on data such as precipitation, soil temperature and moisture, which are used to develop and improve hydrologic models, as well as to validate remote sensing products at medium to coarse resolutions (Jin et al., 2014). At the two superstations for snow cover and frozen ground observations, remote sensing products can be further validated using fine-resolution data. In total, seven AMSs, as well as the frozen ground and snow superstations (also incorporating meteorological observations), were established in the study area during the intensive observation period (IOP: 2013 -2014) to obtain the spatially distributed meteorological variables. After the IOP, four typical AMSs were selected and retained for continuous observation, which is expected to provide long-term datasets. The observed meteorological variables include wind (speed and direction), air temperature, humidity, infrared temperature, air pressure, four-component radiation, and precipitation. Accumulation and depletion processes were measured automatically at the Yakou snow superstation. The observed components included snow depth, snow water equivalent (SWE, measured by GammaMONitor, GMON), albedo of the snow surface and blowing (drifting) snow flux (measured by FlowCapt). Soil temperature and moisture were measured within six layers at each AMS, while evapotranspiration (ET) was observed by eddy covariance (EC) at three AMSs located in permafrost, seasonally frozen ground and a transient zone to observe freeze-thaw (FT) processes. At the sub-basin scale, a wireless sensor network (WSN) with 40 nodes was established to capture seasonal changes in soil temperature and moisture. At the A’rou frozen ground superstation, soil temperature and moisture profiles were intensively measured in eighteen layers to a depth of 3.2 m (in a nested pattern with more layers in the topsoil) to obtain the soil hydrothermal features under freeze-thaw cycles (FTCs). In addition, thermal conductivity and hydraulic conductivity in the topsoil were also measured to observe the dynamic hydrothermal processes within.

Snow depth was measured by SR50A (Campbell, USA), which determines the distance between the sensor and the target by sending out ultrasonic pulses and listening for the returning echoes reflected from the target. Snow water equivalent (SWE) was measured by GMON (CS725 GammaMONitor, Campbell, USA) from 2014/1/1 to 2017/12/31 at a temporal resolution of 6 hr. FlowCapt (IAV, Switzerland) was used to measure the number of blowing snow grains at 3 heights (0-1 m, 1-2 m, and 2-3 m) every 10 mins.

backgroundCn: 阿尔卑斯地区在河流和流域生态系统中具有重要意义，作为淡水的来源，提供并刺激特定栖息地的生物多样性。与此同时，近年来气候变化、人类活动和其他扰动可能会干扰水文过程和生态功能，因此需要下一代观测和建模方法，以推进对阿尔卑斯地区这些过程的预测理解。阿尔卑斯地区的水资源是需要调节的源头水，以维持下游生态系统。然而，近年来自然/气候变化和人类活动引发的扰动显著改变了水文过程和生态功能。因此，准确估计和预测水文过程及其关键影响因素变得至关重要。

不幸的是，由于高山地区观测数据的稀缺，主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍，阻碍了高山水文建模及相关研究，但也促使了下一代生态系统观测网络和实验的发展。与观测数据相比，结合数据同化的遥感数据可以改善水文过程的预测。然而，由于地球系统的复杂性，遥感数据（尤其是在高山地区）存在各种不确定性来源，这些不确定性需要进行验证和校准。总之，为了填补知识空白并促进高山地区水文学研究，集成的、分布式的和多尺度的观测数据集是必不可少的，预计将为水文建模提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终改善对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。在高山水文学中，除了从分布式气象站获得的一致的水文气象数据外，雪盖和冻土是两个重要的指标和驱动因素，影响水文过程。融化前的最大雪水当量（SWE）决定了雪融水的储存——这是高山地区淡水的主要来源，而冻融循环（FTC）和活层内的土壤水分则改变了水的渗透，进而影响地表径流和地下水。为了促进高山水文学研究，国际高山研究流域水文学网络（INARCH）于2015年由世界气候研究计划（WCRP）的全球能量与水交换（GEWEX）项目发起，涉及全球18个流域。自那时以来，INARCH将各个观测站连接成一个国际网络和数据共享平台，以引领高山地区水文气象和雪观测的前沿研究。另一个基于社区的观测网络，极圈活层监测（CALM）网络，始于1990年代初，旨在观察活层和近地表永久冻土对气候变化的响应。黑河流域（HRB）是中国第二大内陆河流域，以其异质的景观、多样的生态系统、独特的地理特征和近年来的气候变化而闻名。作为干旱/半干旱黑河流域生态水文过程的主要组成部分，高山水文过程，特别是与上游雪盖和冻土相关的过程，对山区的径流产生了重大影响，从而调节中游的农业发展和下游的生态系统。

近年来，随着气候变暖，永冻土的退化显著影响了径流和碳循环（Peng et al., 2016; Gao et al., 2018）。研究区域内雪盖广泛分布，具有独特的特征。在高海拔山区（海拔 > 3800 米），受当地微气候和低温的影响，任何季节都有可能出现降雪。临时雪是该地区中低海拔地区的主要雪盖类型，因为强烈的太阳辐射和高气温导致雪的快速融化和升华。漂移雪在该地区也常见，这可能导致高海拔地区雪层的重新分布（Essery et al., 1999; Li et al., 2014）。
由于祁连山的高海拔和复杂地形，常常观察到吹雪（漂浮雪）。估计吹雪的发生是重要的，因为它可能导致雪盖的重新分布，并影响雪的升华。
土壤热导率的分析比较困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。因此，可以利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。
research objectiveCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从一个综合的、分布式的和多尺度的观测网络中研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。
相关的开放获取数据集包括高质量的水文气象数据，特别是针对子流域和流域尺度的雪和冻土观测，旨在解决多种科学问题，包括但不限于：（1）如何为高山水文模型提供准确有效的强迫数据，（2）如何整合观测、模拟和获取的数据集以获得有意义的理解，以及（3）扰动（气候变化和人类活动）如何改变基本过程。
challengesCn: 然而，寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形等几大严峻挑战，阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。
不幸的是，由于获取数据的困难和技术障碍，阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺阻碍了阿尔卑斯水文模型及相关研究的发展，但也促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发。然而，上述建模工作面临着两个主要问题：1）强迫数据的可用性（只有中国气象局在HRB上游的两个气象站在运行）；2）缺乏高质量的雪和冻土数据用于参数化。
不幸的是，由于强风的影响，这项工作并没有顺利进行。因此，目前无法获得可以通过雪深和雪水当量（SWE）数据计算的雪密度数据。
methodsCn: 无间断的气象和水文数据通过连接一组自动气象站（AMSs）的观测网络进行监测。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从一个雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性。高分辨率的土壤物理数据集也从一个冻土观测超级站获得，以捕捉冻融过程。

考虑到研究地点的特征，建立了一个综合的、分布式的多尺度水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络，配备了七个自动气象站（AMS）和两个超级站。在流域尺度上，观测旨在收集数据，以研究气象驱动因素并验证阿尔卑斯水文模型。在子流域尺度上，小规模的观测和测量集中在降水、土壤温度和湿度等数据上，这些数据用于开发和改进水文模型，以及验证中等到粗分辨率的遥感产品（Jin et al., 2014）。在两个用于雪盖和冻土观测的超级站中，可以利用高分辨率数据进一步验证遥感产品。在密集观测期（IOP：2013-2014）期间，在研究区域建立了七个AMS以及冻土和雪超级站（也包含气象观测），以获取空间分布的气象变量。在IOP之后，选择并保留了四个典型的AMS进行持续观测，预计将提供长期数据集。观测的气象变量包括风速和风向、气温、湿度、红外温度、气压、四分量辐射和降水。雅口雪超级站自动测量积累和消耗过程，观测的组成部分包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE，由GammaMONitor测量）、雪面反照率和吹雪（飘雪）通量（由FlowCapt测量）。在每个AMS内，土壤温度和湿度在六个层次上进行测量，而蒸散发（ET）则在位于永久冻土、季节性冻土和过渡区的三个AMS上通过涡度协方差（EC）进行观测，以观察冻融（FT）过程。在子流域尺度上，建立了一个包含40个节点的无线传感器网络（WSN），以捕捉土壤温度和湿度的季节变化。在阿柔冻土超级站，土壤温度和湿度剖面在18个层次上进行密集测量，深度达到3.2米（采用嵌套模式，表层有更多层次），以获取冻融循环（FTC）下的土壤水热特征。此外，还测量了表层土壤的热导率和水力导率，以观察动态水热过程。

雪深是通过SR50A（美国Campbell）测量的，该设备通过发出超声波脉冲并监听从目标反射回来的回声来确定传感器与目标之间的距离。雪水当量（SWE）是通过GMON（CS725 GammaMONitor，美国Campbell）在2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日期间以6小时的时间分辨率进行测量的。FlowCapt（瑞士IAV）用于测量在3个高度（0-1米、1-2米和2-3米）每10分钟的吹雪颗粒数量。
datasetCn: 本研究提供了一套数据集，包括长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据，用于从综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络研究中国黑河流域上游的流域科学和功能。通过连接一组自动气象站（AMS）的观测网络，监测到了无间隙的气象和水文数据。此外，为了捕捉雪的积累和融化过程，使用先进的技术和仪器从雪观测超级站收集了雪盖特性数据。还获得了高分辨率的土壤物理数据集，以捕捉冻融过程，这些数据来自冻土观测超级站。更新的数据集已向具有多学科背景的科学家发布（如冰冻圈科学、水文学和气象学），预计将作为测试平台，为更广泛的社区提供准确的强迫数据，并验证和评估遥感产品和水文模型。
本文介绍了HRB地区综合阿尔卑斯水文观测网络的基础设施以及近年来收集的完整数据集。该观测网络由七个标准水文气象站、一个雪超级站和一个冻土超级站组成，作为一个综合研究平台，旨在提供HRB上游水文气象过程的显著数据集（如水文气象、雪和冻土），预计将支持阿尔卑斯地区水文模型的开发和模拟以及遥感观测。
来自Yakou雪超级站的综合雪数据集自2013年夏季以来已更新。观察到的雪变量包括雪深、雪水当量（SWE）和吹雪（漂雪）。2014年1月1日至2017年12月31日的数据在图4中进行了总结，并附有降水、蒸散发、土壤温度和湿度的额外图表。数据集的可用时间为2012年12月5日至2017年12月31日，间歇性丢失主要是由于高海拔地区的电力损失和传感器故障。
在本文中，展示了一套来自于黑河上游集成、分布式和多尺度的水文气象-雪-冻土观测网络的阿尔卑斯水文数据集。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced during data collection in the alpine region compared to the oasis agricultural area?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区与绿洲农业区进行数据收集时面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In the alpine region, challenges include the cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography, which inhibit consistent data collection and hinder the development of remote sensing technologies. In contrast, the oasis agricultural area faces challenges like the strong advective environment that complicates surface flux estimation and the incomplete energy balance closure with respect to available energy. The scarcity of observation data is a common issue in both regions, but the alpine region is particularly affected due to technological barriers and accessibility.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在阿尔卑斯地区，挑战包括寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形，这些因素抑制了一致的数据收集，并阻碍了遥感技术的发展。相比之下，绿洲农业区面临的挑战包括强烈的平流环境，这使得表面通量估算变得复杂，以及可用能量方面的不完全能量平衡闭合。观察数据的稀缺是两个地区的共同问题，但阿尔卑斯地区由于技术障碍和可达性问题，尤其受到影响。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do the observed changes in latent heat fluxes contribute to our understanding of evapotranspiration processes in strongly advective, irrigated agricultural areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 观察到的潜热通量变化如何有助于我们理解强烈平流的灌溉农业地区的蒸散发过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Observed changes in latent heat fluxes can provide insights into the components of evapotranspiration, such as soil evaporation and plant transpiration. In strongly advective, irrigated areas, these changes can help differentiate the contributions of soil and vegetation to total evapotranspiration, enhancing the accuracy of models used for water resource management.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 观察到的潜热通量变化可以提供对蒸散发组成部分的洞察，例如土壤蒸发和植物蒸腾。在强烈的平流灌溉区域，这些变化可以帮助区分土壤和植被对总蒸散发的贡献，从而提高用于水资源管理模型的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions, especially when attempting to model hydrological processes?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，尤其是在尝试对水文过程进行建模时，导致观测数据稀缺的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions is primarily due to the difficulties of access and technological barriers. The cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed, which hinders the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺主要是由于获取困难和技术障碍。寒冷和恶劣的气候、高海拔以及复杂的地形阻碍了在需要的地方和时间进行全面和一致的数据收集，这妨碍了遥感技术和阿尔卑斯水文模型的发展。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the causes behind the challenges of accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量面临的挑战的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. This is often compounded by errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. Additionally, the strong advective environment in these regions further complicates accurate estimation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，因为表面与空气温度差的不确定性。来自表面复合辐射温度的表面土壤和植被成分温度的确定误差常常加剧了这一问题。此外，这些地区强烈的平流环境进一步复杂化了准确估计的过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to measure the soil heat conductivity in alpine regions, and how does this impact hydrological modeling?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在高山地区，测量土壤热导率困难的原因是什么，这对水文模型有什么影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Soil heat conductivity is difficult to analyze because it is a function of soil density, soil moisture content (ice content in frozen ground), and soil temperature, which cannot be easily calculated using a simple formula. This difficulty impacts hydrological modeling as site observations must be utilized to evaluate the parameterization of alpine hydrologic models.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 土壤热导率的分析较为困难，因为它是土壤密度、土壤水分含量（在冻土中为冰含量）和土壤温度的函数，这些因素无法通过简单的公式轻易计算。这种困难影响了水文模型的构建，因为必须利用现场观测来评估高山水文模型的参数化。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What could be the consequences of using high-resolution thermal camera data for estimating evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热成像数据估算异质景观中的蒸散发可能会产生的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using high-resolution thermal camera data allows for more accurate estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures, which can improve the separation of latent fluxes of soil and vegetation components. This leads to a better estimation of evapotranspiration (ET) and its components, evaporation (E) and transpiration (T), even in strongly advective conditions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪数据可以更准确地估计土壤和冠层组分的温度，这有助于更好地区分土壤和植被组分的潜热通量。这将改善蒸散发（ET）及其组分蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）的估算，即使在强烈的平流条件下也是如此。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives of implementing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network for alpine hydrology research in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在黑河上游实施一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度观测网络的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective of implementing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network for alpine hydrology research in the upper reaches of the Heihe River Basin is to provide accurate forcing data for hydrological modeling, validate remote sensing data, allow the evaluation of distributed models, and ultimately improve a predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions. This network aims to address the scientific challenges posed by climate change and human activities that alter fundamental hydrological processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在黑河上游实施一个集成的、分布式的、多尺度的高山水文观测网络的目标是为水文模型提供准确的强迫数据，验证遥感数据，评估分布式模型，并最终提高对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。该网络旨在应对气候变化和人类活动对基本水文过程造成的科学挑战。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures in estimating evapotranspiration (E, T, and ET) in agricultural areas?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在估算农业区的蒸散（E、T 和 ET）时使用地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures is important for estimating evapotranspiration (E, T, and ET) because it allows for better validation of these estimates with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and ET measurements using an eddy covariance system. This approach helps in accurately separating soil and vegetation component temperatures, which is crucial for estimating E and T under a variety of vegetation types and conditions, ultimately enhancing the reliability of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度对于估算蒸散发（E、T 和 ET）非常重要，因为它可以更好地验证这些估算与观察到的 E（E/ET%）和 T（T/ET%）比率，使用稳定的氧和氢同位素，以及使用涡度协方差系统的 ET 测量。这种方法有助于准确区分土壤和植被组分温度，这对于在各种植被类型和条件下估算 E 和 T 至关重要，最终增强了双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的可靠性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the significance of developing next-generation ecosystem observation networks in alpine regions?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在高山地区开发下一代生态系统观测网络的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks in alpine regions is significant because it addresses the challenges posed by the scarcity of observation data due to difficult access and technological barriers. These networks aim to provide high-quality, long-term datasets that are crucial for advancing predictive understanding of hydrological processes, validating remote sensing data, and improving hydrological models. Such networks are essential for studying the impacts of climate change and human activities on hydrological processes and eco-functions in alpine catchments.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 下一代生态观察网络在高山地区的发展具有重要意义，因为它解决了由于难以进入和技术障碍而导致的观测数据稀缺问题。这些网络旨在提供高质量的长期数据集，这对于推进对水文过程的预测理解、验证遥感数据以及改善水文模型至关重要。这些网络对于研究气候变化和人类活动对高山流域水文过程和生态功能的影响是必不可少的。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in ensuring the quality and reliability of the hydrometeorological data collected from the observation network in the Heihe River Basin?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保从黑河流域观测网络收集的水文气象数据质量和可靠性的程序有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To ensure quality and reliability, data processing involved several steps: ensuring daily data completeness (with 144 data points per day, each collected every 10 minutes), marking missing data with -6999, removing duplicate records, deleting data that is outside of physical or instrumental range, and marking questionable data with red text. Dates and times were standardized into a single column.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了确保数据的质量和可靠性，数据处理涉及几个步骤：确保每日数据完整（每天有144个数据点，每10分钟收集一次），用-6999标记缺失数据，删除重复记录，删除超出物理或仪器范围的数据，并用红色文本标记可疑数据。日期和时间被标准化为一个单独的列。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are soil and canopy component temperatures estimated and validated for use in the TSEB model?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 土壤和冠层组件温度是如何在TSEB模型中进行估计和验证的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Soil and canopy component temperatures are estimated using images from a thermal infrared camera. The images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method, and directional brightness temperatures are extracted. These thermal infrared temperatures are converted to radiation temperatures using sky long-wave radiation and soil/canopy emissivities. Simulated radiometric temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures obtained from a four-component radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 土壤和冠层组件的温度是通过热红外相机的图像进行估算的。图像使用最大似然法分类为土壤和冠层像素，并提取方向亮度温度。这些热红外温度通过天空长波辐射和土壤/冠层发射率转换为辐射温度。模拟的辐射温度与从四分量辐射计获得的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are employed to measure snow properties like snow water equivalent and snow depth in high-altitude regions, and how are these data integrated into hydrological models?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在高海拔地区，测量雪水当量和雪深等雪特性的方法有哪些，这些数据又是如何整合到水文模型中的？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Snow properties are measured using instruments like the GammaMONitor (GMON) for snow water equivalent and the SR50A sensor for snow depth. These measurements are made at a snow observation superstation, capturing snow accumulation and ablation processes. The data collected are used to validate remote sensing products and are integrated into hydrological models to enhance the understanding of alpine hydrological processes.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 雪的属性通过仪器如伽马监测器（GammaMONitor，GMON）测量雪水当量，以及SR50A传感器测量雪深。这些测量在雪观测超级站进行，捕捉雪的积累和融化过程。收集的数据用于验证遥感产品，并集成到水文模型中，以增强对高山水文过程的理解。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions enable the effective separation of soil and canopy temperatures in the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model for accurate evapotranspiration estimation?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件能够有效分离土壤和冠层温度，以便在双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型中准确估算蒸散发？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The effective separation of soil and canopy temperatures in the TSEB model is enabled by using high-resolution thermal infrared imagery to accurately classify and estimate component temperatures. This separation is crucial for obtaining reliable estimates of evapotranspiration (ET) and its components under heterogeneous land surfaces.
Enablement.AnswerCn: TSEB模型中有效分离土壤和冠层温度的能力得益于使用高分辨率热红外影像来准确分类和估计各组成部分的温度。这种分离对于在异质土地表面下获得可靠的蒸散发（ET）及其组成部分的估计至关重要。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How does the integration of remote sensing data and data assimilation techniques enable improved prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 遥感数据与数据同化技术的结合如何提高对高山地区水文过程的预测能力？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The integration of remote sensing data and data assimilation techniques enables improved prediction of hydrological processes in alpine regions by providing comprehensive datasets that validate and calibrate complex models. These techniques address the uncertainties in remote sensing data, particularly in challenging alpine environments, thereby enhancing predictive accuracy.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 遥感数据与数据同化技术的结合能够通过提供全面的数据集来验证和校准复杂模型，从而改善对高山地区水文过程的预测。这些技术解决了遥感数据中的不确定性，特别是在具有挑战性的高山环境中，从而提高了预测的准确性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the continuous monitoring of snow cover and frozen ground processes in high-altitude regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在高海拔地区能够持续监测雪盖和冻土过程？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological advancements such as automatic meteorological stations (AMSs), snow observation superstations equipped with state-of-the-art instruments, and wireless sensor networks (WSNs) have enabled the continuous monitoring of snow cover and frozen ground processes. These systems capture detailed and distributed hydrometeorological data crucial for understanding complex alpine hydrology.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术进步，如自动气象站（AMS）、配备先进仪器的雪观测超级站和无线传感器网络（WSN），使得对雪盖和冻土过程的持续监测成为可能。这些系统捕获了详细且分布广泛的水文气象数据，对于理解复杂的高山水文过程至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the data collection methods in alpine hydrology face significant challenges despite advancements in technology?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 尽管技术取得了进步，为什么高山水文学的数据收集方法仍可能面临重大挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The cold and harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography inhibit complete and consistent data collection where/when needed. These challenges hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models, as well as the availability of the forcing data needed for these models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 寒冷而严酷的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形阻碍了在需要时进行全面和一致的数据收集。这些挑战妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展，以及这些模型所需的强迫数据的获取。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What reasons could explain the scarcity of observation data in alpine regions and how might this impact hydrological research?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 哪些原因可以解释高山地区观测数据的稀缺，以及这可能如何影响水文研究？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The scarcity of observation data in alpine regions is due to difficulties of access and technological barriers, which have hindered hydrological modeling and associated research. This lack of data has motivated the development of next-generation ecosystem observation networks and experiments to provide accurate forcing data and validate remote sensing products and hydrological models.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 阿尔卑斯地区观测数据的稀缺是由于获取困难和技术障碍，这阻碍了水文建模和相关研究。数据的缺乏促使了下一代生态观测网络和实验的开发，以提供准确的强迫数据并验证遥感产品和水文模型。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What is your evaluation of the potential effectiveness of using an integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network for improving alpine hydrological models?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评价使用集成、分布式、多尺度观测网络来改善高山水文模型的潜在有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The integrated, distributed, and multiscale observation network in the Heihe River Basin offers a comprehensive approach to collecting data for alpine hydrological models. This approach is likely effective as it combines long-term hydrometeorological, snow cover, and frozen ground data. It provides accurate forcing data, enhances the validation of remote sensing products, and improves the predictive understanding of alpine hydrological processes and ecosystem functions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 黑河流域的综合、分布式和多尺度观测网络为收集高山水文模型的数据提供了一种全面的方法。这种方法有效地结合了长期的水文气象、雪盖和冻土数据。它提供了准确的强迫数据，增强了遥感产品的验证，并改善了对高山水文过程和生态系统功能的预测理解。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you assess the challenges associated with collecting high-quality snow and frozen ground data in alpine regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在高山地区收集高质量雪和冻土数据所面临的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The collection of high-quality snow and frozen ground data in alpine regions is challenging due to the cold, harsh climate, high altitude, and complex topography. These factors inhibit data collection and hinder the development of remote sensing technologies and alpine hydrological models. However, advancements in observational networks and technologies are gradually overcoming these barriers, providing more comprehensive datasets for analysis.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，收集高质量的雪和冻土数据面临挑战，因为寒冷、恶劣的气候、高海拔和复杂的地形。这些因素阻碍了数据收集，并妨碍了遥感技术和高山水文模型的发展。然而，观测网络和技术的进步正在逐渐克服这些障碍，为分析提供更全面的数据集。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data collection in remote alpine regions can overcome the challenges of harsh climates and technological barriers.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在偏远的高山地区，数据收集如何克服恶劣气候和技术障碍的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data collection in remote alpine regions is facilitated by establishing an integrated, distributed, and multiscale hydrometeorological observation network, which includes automatic meteorological stations and superstations for snow and frozen ground observations. This network is designed to capture comprehensive datasets necessary for studying hydrological processes despite the harsh environments.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在偏远的高山地区，数据收集通过建立一个综合的、分布式的、多尺度的水文气象观测网络得以促进，该网络包括自动气象站和用于雪和冻土观测的超级站。该网络旨在捕捉全面的数据集，以便在恶劣环境下研究水文过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how continuous and gap-free meteorological data are maintained in high-altitude areas with complex topography and weather conditions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解在高海拔地区复杂的地形和天气条件下，如何保持连续且无间断的气象数据。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Continuous and gap-free meteorological data in high-altitude areas are maintained through a network of automatic meteorological stations and additional superstations. These stations are equipped to automatically monitor various meteorological parameters and soil conditions, ensuring consistent data collection despite complex topography and challenging weather conditions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 高海拔地区的连续和无间断气象数据通过自动气象站和额外的超级站网络进行维护。这些站点配备了自动监测各种气象参数和土壤条件的设备，确保在复杂的地形和恶劣的天气条件下仍能持续收集数据。
